content:
Meeting 2021-05-04T17:00:00+02:00

Agenda:

  • Triage, as always
  • Rust roadmap and Clippy
  • ...
Meeting in T-7 min
@T-clippy Meeting time! o/
Hmm, let's wait 1-2min if more people arrive :)
Ok let's start with Triage
#80357 Will probably land after the sync on Thursday. This has many Clippy changes. We may see regressins from it in Clippy

The other thing I had is the upcoming release: I have time to write the changelog this time.

Has anything landed in the last few days that we want to get into beta before the release?
If not, @triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
Oh, it's also worth to note, that we manged to get to around 10 open PRs at the time. :tada: (I think this is a good thing, as long as PRs are still coming in :+1:
Now that we don't ahve as many PRs at the same time: The next topic is the Rust roadmap
We have to write some documents for it. I plan to start to work on it until the next meeting.
So team members first and then the wider community should expect me bugging them to give feedback/add content to the required documents. :)
That's all from me for today: Any other topics to discuss? @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
@flip1995 do we have documents to write for the rust roadmap?
i feel like the required documents are for charter work and that's not yet begun with our team (core is working with small groups of teams at a time)
Ah I thought every team can start on their own. But we can also wait until core tells us to write those documents.
But in that case, I guess we'll wait?
We can discuss this offline. Thanks for attending everyone :wave:
Ah, I just saw https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/832. In that case, we should just wait. Well, less work on that front :+1:
